aboutMe.name: Paul
interests: Gaming (remember the good old Verdansk days)
Building wooden model kits like Rokr
aboutMe.bio: I am a software developer based in Derby. I have spent the previous years of my career as a painter and decorator and I'm ready to wash out the rollers and brushes one more time and swap the brushstrokes for keystrokes. I have a passion for being creative and really enjoy all aspects of software development, from design all the way through to code.
aboutMe.goals: I am looking for my first role within the tech community. I want to make a difference in the world through software and give back to the same kind of communities I grew up in.

transferrableSkills.name: Team Collaboration
transferrableSkills.example: Working alongside other trades is the same as working alongside other devs. You always need to know a little about the person you are working alongside's job. As an example in painting I need to know about joinery to make sure we are working seamlessly together. This would be the same if I was a frontend developer on a project, I would need to collaborate and have at least a basic understanding of what the backend developer is doing and what the backend is doing in general.

projects.name: Shardlow St James FC
projects.description: A complete website for a local amateur football club. It uses the FA API to integrate the 4 teams fixtures, results and table data. Has a web scraper built using Playwright to scrape data from Instagram.

projects.name: AMH Decorating
projects.description: A complete website for a local painter and decorator to be more visual and generate more custom. Built from scratch using Figma and designed in collaboration with the client

projects.name: Ivy's Game
projects.description: I asked my daughter to come up with a game and she had the idea of a user copying an image and getting a score based on the likeness. So I ran with that and did some research into an educational game. It led me down the path of learning how to use a canvas in React, how to send data to and from client and server, how to parse that data and get exactly what I want. How to transform aan image to a base64 string, and how to use an AI engine to compare the image. Among many other things.
